author: Peter Wright
content: We have an 80 foot all electric mega all carbon fibre motor-yacht in our local yard burnt out. The inside damage is truly horrific. It happened at berth fortunately. How lithium batteries are allowed at sea is beyond me.

author: Michael Daley, Electrical Engineer
content: Utility-scale battery storage sytems like Moss Landing will probably ALL catch fire eventually. They are only safe when surrounded by miles of water where they can set fire to nothing. On land, these are pyrotechnic time bambs with unknown fuse lengths.
